bibl.title: The Death of Antisthenes, or P. Oxy. XI 1366 Revisited.
bibl.note: P. Oxy. XI, 1366 (= M.-P.3 2502; LDAB 2432). - The Manuscript and Its Script. - Previous Scholarly Work. - A New Proposal for Identification of the Nature of the Text [beginning of a μελέτη, more specifically a historical forensic declamation, where a historical figure was represented as standing trial for some charge]. - The Text. - The Authorship [Dio Chrysostom or Aelius Aristides?].
bibl.seg: Rosalia Hatzilambrou, The Death of Antisthenes, or P. Oxy. XI 1366 Revisited.

P. Oxy. XI, 1366 (= M.-P.3 2502; LDAB 2432). - The Manuscript and Its Script. - Previous Scholarly Work. - A New Proposal for Identification of the Nature of the Text [beginning of a μελέτη, more specifically a historical forensic declamation, where a historical figure was represented as standing trial for some charge]. - The Text. - The Authorship [Dio Chrysostom or Aelius Aristides?].
